conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text:
Based on user preference cues, I would recommend "What Women Want" and "Titanic".
Both movies feature compelling storylines that have captured audiences around the world.
In "What Women Want", a cocky, chauvinistic advertising executive magically acquires the ability to hear what women are thinking. As he begins to understand women's perspectives and desires, he discovers that true happiness and fulfillment come from understanding and embracing others' perspectives and desires.
In "Titanic", a wealthy socialite and a poor artist fall in love with each other on the ill-fated R. M. S. Titanic, which sank to the bottom of the Atlantic Ocean after a catastrophic failure of its watertight compartments during its maiden voyage from Southampton, United Kingdom, to New York City, United States, on April 14, 1912.
As the ship begins to sink, the socialite and the artist begin to realize that their love for each other will not be enough to keep them alive in the rapidly sinking ship.
In the midst of this intense emotional turmoil, the artist suddenly has an idea for a new painting that he wants to create using all the materials available on the ill-fated R. M. S. Titanic.

Three stop in an alley so that Nick can relieve. His friends are forced into the lost black van by two druges. The other car of friends are informed by the kidnappers that if they want to see them again they have to do exactly what they say. It is revealed that the kidnappers are a modern day Jack the Ripper duo, stalking the streets, picking up prostitutes whom they murder and mutilate. These killer/kidnappers alarmed for being followed, frame these guys.

- Title: The Shawshank Redemption  | Plot: Based on a true story, this film tells the story of Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins), who has been wrongfully convicted of murder and sent to Shawshank State Penitentiary. Despite his time behind bars, he never loses hope and continues to learn from his fellow inmates. Through his friendship with Red (Morgan Freeman), as well as his interactions with other prisoners, Andy learns the true meaning of life: to love and be loved in return. Ultimately, Andy's unwavering spirit and ability to find beauty even in adversity inspire us all to never give up on our dreams, no matter how difficult they may seem at first.  | Starring: Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman
